headline: Lockheed Stock Rises Despite Downgrade. It’s Losing Wall Street Support.
summary: Lockheed Martin  shook off early losses, rising on Thursday despite catching a Wall Street downgrade.  TD Cowen analyst Gautam Khanna downgraded shares of the defense contractor to Hold from Buy, citing uncertainty about prospects for its F-35 jet under the second Trump administration and “fairly persistent execution challenges.”

raw.headline: Lockheed Stock Rises Despite Downgrade. It’s Losing Wall Street Support.

headline: Will Budget Slash Cut Lockheed's Nuclear Space Propulsion Flight Short?
summary: LMT's DRACO project cut by budget slashes, but its deep NASA ties and NEP work keep its space ambitions alive.

headline: Lockheed Stock Falls on Downgrade. It’s Losing Wall Street Support.
summary: Lockheed  Martin stock dropped early Thursday after catching a Wall Street downgrade.  TD Cowen analyst Gautam Khanna downgraded shares of the defense contractor to Hold from Buy, citing uncertainty about prospects for its F-35 jet under the second Trump administration and “fairly persistent execution challenges.”  Lockheed’s loss of the F-47 sixth-generation fighter jet program to  Boeing  —announced in March—will result in some additional expenses, he says, adding there have been “cost overruns on a classified aero program.”
